text.id: 7. Akay, kayokay rana na koman so nimay!
text.citation: Rau, D. V., & Dong, M. N. (2006). Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary. Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica.
text.BibTeX_citation: @book{rau2006yami, title={Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary}, author={Rau, D Victoria and Dong, Maa-Neu}, year={2006}, publisher={Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica}}
text.source: ['7. Akay, kayokay rana na koman so nimay!', '祖父，起來吃芋糕！', 'Grandpa, come eat taro cake!', '', 'si apen Ogaog (M, 69, Iranmilek)', '黃馬期，男，69，東清村', '']

S.FORM: yaken rana am, mina apia dang o kakawan a, k-aro namen a ka-k-anak-an a mi-al-alam do Jicinikcikan ito a.
S.TRANSL: 我呢，那天天氣很好，所以我們很多小孩子就都去Jicinikcikan遊玩
As for me, one day the weather was very good, and a lot of us children went to Jicinikcikan to play.

S.FORM: karaan na am, m-ángsah ko rana, ta ji ko á-kaha, to ko rana ngítkeh, ta mi ko rana m-itkeh koan ko am, to ko rana ngóli a.
S.TRANSL: 後來覺得無聊，想睡覺；我就想，還是回家去睡覺好了，於是就回家了
At the time I felt bored and sleepy. As I thought about it, I wanted to sleep, so I went home.

S.FORM: “ma-ngay ko pala jira Akay an” koan ko a, ka-to ko angay-an, “a ji ko manci-an, ji ko yokay-a”.
S.TRANSL: 途中我想“去祖父家看看” ，我就去了。我想“我要跟他說 。還是不要吵醒他的好”
As I walked home, I thought, “I’ll go to Grandpa’s,” and I went. “I’ll tell him I’ll not wake him up.”

S.FORM: karaan am, “yokay-in ko si Akay saon, ta ya ni-mang-may si Ina” koan ko, ka-to ko angay-an ji akay ta icialaw a.
S.TRANSL: 後來我又想“還是叫醒祖父吧，就說，我媽媽做了芋糕” ，就這樣，我去了祖父的家
“I’ll wake him up, saying, Mom has made taro cake.” I went with this thought.

S.FORM: karaan na am, “mo Akay!” koan ko am, ji pa mi-zi-ziak, ta m-itkeh ori a, “mo Akay!” “ikongo manga apo ko?”
S.TRANSL: 我去了之後，就喊道：“祖父！” 可是他在睡覺，沒有回應；我就再喊一次：“祖父！” “什麼事啊？孫子”
When I arrived I shouted, “Grandpa!” He didn’t reply because he was still asleep, so I cried again, “Grandpa!” “What is it, my grandson?”

S.FORM: “mo Akay!” “ikongo, mo panci-an yaken manga apo ko?” “ya ni-mang-may si Ina, t-om-anggah ka kono”,
S.TRANSL: “祖父！” “叫我有什麼事嗎，孫子” ，“聽說我媽媽做了芋糕，請你上去吃”
“Grandpa!” “What is it, my grandson?” “They said Mom made taro cake for you and invite you up to eat.”

S.FORM: karaan am, ma-ngay ko rana do vahay namen a, ma-níring si Ina am, “ya ka rana ni-man-ngo ya, mo koimo, ka ji a-kaha pa ya?” koan na yaken a.
S.TRANSL: 後來我就到家了，我媽說“孩子，你怎麼這麼晚回來？還不想睡哦”
When I got home, Mom said, “Why did you come back so late? Aren’t you sleepy?”

S.FORM: “todey mapa-lalak so ra-rakeh ”karaan na am, ni-totoaw-an na rana ni Akay a.
S.TRANSL: “你怎麼可以這樣欺騙老人家呢？” 才說完，祖父來了
“How dare you trick the elders?” Just as she said that, Grandpa came in.

S.FORM: “Ama kong a, ka ma-ngay jino, mo keypong?” “na ni-yokay yaken ni Apo ito a, angay do tey-ngato, ta ya ni-mang-may si ina koan na”,
S.TRANSL: “親愛的爸爸好，你怎麼來了？” “是孫子把我叫醒的，他說媽媽做了芋糕，叫我上來（吃）”
“Dear Dad, why have you come?” “Grandson woke me up, and he said you had made taro cake and invited me up.”

S.FORM: “ya ji abo, Ama kong a, ya ji abo, mo keypong a, ji á-sta yaken a na ni-yokay ni tamazang ito a”,
S.TRANSL: “沒有芋糕呢，親愛的爸爸，真不好意思，真的沒有呢，你看，我也被他叫醒了，真是的
“There is no taro cake, Dear Dad. Look at me, I have also been woken up by that naughty boy.

S.FORM: “ko ni-panci si Akay a ni-yokay”, “ta mo todey yokay-i sia”, “ya ni-mang-may si Ina” koan ko, “ásio todey mapa-lalak so ra-rakeh a, ásio ka ya?”
S.TRANSL: “我已叫醒了祖父” “為什麼要叫醒他？” 我說“媽媽做了芋糕” “你怎麼可以這樣欺騙老人家呢，你怎麼這樣？！”
He told me about waking you, I asked him why he woke you and he said that I had made taro cake. I said how dare he tricked the elders.”

S.FORM: “a ya abo an, ya abo, manga anak ko, a”, “a ya ji abo, mo keypong a, ji ka ma-karilaw, mo keypong a, na todey yokay-a ni apo mo”,
S.TRANSL: “沒有哦，真的沒有哦，孩子！那麼 ”，“是的，真的沒有芋糕，親愛的。你的孫子吵醒了你，真是不好意思”
“Oh, there is none, my child? If there is not, then ”“No, there is no taro cake. I am sorry that your grandson woke you up.”

S.FORM: “ciaha, mo keypong a, si Apo ya todey yokay jiaken a, ko ka-teng-an na k-abo, manga anak ko am” “y-owsok ko rana, manga apo ko an”.
S.TRANSL: “沒關係，親愛的。是孫子來叫醒我的，我也不知道原來沒有芋糕。那麼我下去囉，親愛的孫子”
“It’s okay, dear. My grandson woke me up, and I didn’t even know there was no taro cake. (But if there isn’t any), then I’ll just go home, Dear Grandson.”

S.FORM: karaan na am, ma-’ayo rana ori a, a m-osok rana ori am, maka-logod am ma-zokot a om-osok a.
S.TRANSL: 就這樣，他很失望的下去了。然後看到他低著頭駝著背的身影回去了
And he left the house disappointed. I watched his back as he walked back home with his head lowered and shoulders drooped.

S.FORM: “a ji ka ma-kasi, mo keypong, am ásio, mo keypong, ikong to ko ngmáy-a a ma-la-lahet a waka-wakay ito am”, ma-’ayo a om-osok a.
S.TRANSL: “真的不好意思呢，親愛的爸爸；但真的沒有芋糕呢，我們有的只是一些不好的地瓜，做不成糕點呢” ，就這樣，他很失望的回家去了
“Dear Dad, I’m so sorry. How can I make any taro cake when the only things in the house are a few lousy sweet potatoes?” He walked down disappointed.

S.FORM: “a todey yokay so ra-rakeh ta, wánja o ya na ni-akan ni akay mo a ka-to mo yokay-an sia”.
S.TRANSL: “怎麼可以這樣叫醒老人家，你看你祖父來（家裡）吃什麼，真是的！”
How dare you get an old man up like this. What did your grandpa get to eat? Why did you wake him up? Jeez!”

S.FORM: “ya ko m-ai jia am, ya ko todey nibo ji Akay a yokay-in ang”, do akma so sang a.
S.TRANSL: “那是我要回來的時候臨時想到要去叫醒祖父的嘛” 。這是當時的情形
“I was going to come straight home, and going the grandpa’s was a last minute decision.” Just like that.

S.FORM: ika-doa na araw am, i-pang-may na rana ori, ta i-k-arilaw na ni-pa-lalak ko ang, do akma sang,
S.TRANSL: 第二天，我媽因為可憐祖父被我騙醒，所以她就特地為他做了芋糕；像這樣
The next day, my mom made taro cake for Grandpa because she was sorry about my trickery. Just like that.

S.FORM: ka-tey-má-rahet no k-anak-an ya a mang-alalas,
S.TRANSL: 所以啊，小孩子欺騙老人家是件很糟糕的事情
Therefore it is really bad for a child to trick (elders).

S.FORM: ta todey yokay so ra-rakeh, ta ikong o angayan na no akma so sang am,
S.TRANSL: 像這樣隨便叫醒老人家的行為，實在是沒有意義（很無聊）
It makes no sense to wake up elders for no reasons like that.

S.FORM: ka-ji ani-níg-an no met-metdeh ya, ori rana ya na kavos-an no kava-kavavatanen ko a ya ko on-onong-an.
S.TRANSL: 都是因為小孩子不懂禮貌的緣故。我的故事就此說完了
It is also very rude for children to behave like that. This is the end of my story.

S.FORM: “ma-noyong ori, manga apo ko an?” “nona, ya ji a-noyong a”, “pánma, mo ovay”, ratateng am, to ko rana mánma ori a.
S.TRANSL: “那是真的嗎？孫子” ，“是的，是真的” ，“那你先上去吧，寶貝” ，我就先上去了
“Really, my grandson?” “Yes, really.” “Then go ahead first, my dear.” So I left.

S.FORM: “nona, yaken rana am, ko mi ni-yokay si Akay”, “ta mo mi yokay-an sia?” “ya ni-mang-may si Ina koan ko”,
S.TRANSL: “嗯，我呢，已經去叫醒了祖父” ，“你為什麼叫醒他？” “我說媽媽做了芋糕”
“Uh, I went to wake up Grandpa.” “Why did you wake him up?” “I said Mom made taro cake.”
